FuncDef:
The set tm statistics alarm-threshold command enables the TM packet loss alarm function and configures an alarm threshold for packet loss on the TM board of a specified board.
The undo set tm statistics alarm-threshold command disables the TM packet loss alarm function.
By default, the TM packet loss alarm function is disabled.
CLIs: set tm statistics alarm-threshold [ <entity-id> packets in <second> seconds ] [ slot <slot-id> ]
undo set tm statistics alarm-threshold [ slot <slot-id> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an alarm threshold for the number of lost packets.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295. The default value is 10000.

Specifies a detection period.
The value is an integer ranging from 5 to 3600, in seconds. The default value is 60.

Specifies a slot ID.
The value is a string of 1 to 20 characters.
If no slot ID is specified, the TM packet loss alarm function is enabled for all supported boards.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] set tm statistics alarm-threshold 5000 packets in 10 seconds slot 1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the traffic of all ports on a board is less than 50% of the port bandwidth, enable the TM packet loss alarm function and adjust the alarm threshold as needed if you want to check whether packet loss occurs on the TM board during the forwarding process. A TM packet loss alarm is reported when the total number of lost packets on the TM board exceeds the configured threshold within a specified detection period.
Precautions
This function focuses on packet loss statistics only on the TM module of a board, regardless of packet loss causes.
After an alarm is reported, if the number of lost packets keeps below the alarm threshold for 1 hour, the alarm is cleared.
This command takes effect only on the LPUI-240 series boards.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
